alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 8:02AM PST until January 22 at 11:30AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including eastern portions of San Diego County valleys and coastal mountain slopes of San Diego County. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.15 and 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ramona, Alpine, Julian, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Mount Laguna, Valley Center, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, Fallbrook, Escondido and Hwy 78 Between Ramona And Santa Ysabel. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
